result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:38 PM   Defendant Blanche S Cozart in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Blanche S Cozart.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.   Court reporter Saige Smith.  

Defense requests sig bond states that defendant cannot pay cash at in both cases and requests that the other case be modified to a sig bond (22CM986) and to set for another status 
State defers to the court on bond; and puts offer on the record. 
BTC: BTC: Vacate Warrant do not reinstate bond in case 18CT1332; $250 sig bond in both cases same conditions.  

Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:47 PM Defendant Blanche S Cozart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Blanche S Cozart.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
